cell2d

Class BasicGameState<T extends CellGame>

  • java.lang.Object
    • cell2d.CellGameState<T,BasicGameState<T>,BasicThinker<T>,BasicThinkerState<T>>
      • cell2d.BasicGameState<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The subclass of CellGame that this BasicGameState is used by

    public abstract class BasicGameState<T extends CellGame>
extends CellGameState<T,BasicGameState<T>,BasicThinker<T>,BasicThinkerState<T>>

    A BasicGameState is a type of CellGameState that uses BasicThinkers and BasicThinkerStates, both of which have no special capabilities. It is designed to be easily extended by types of CellGameStates that do not require custom fields or methods to be automatically shared among themselves, their Thinkers, and their ThinkerStates.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Creates a BasicGameState of the specified CellGame with the specified ID.

    • Method Detail

      • getThis

        public BasicGameState<T> getThis()
        Description copied from class: CellGameState
        A method which returns this CellGameState as a U, rather than as a CellGameState<T,U,V,W>. This must be implemented somewhere in the lineage of every subclass of CellGameState in order to get around Java's limitations with regard to generic types.
        Specified by:
        getThis in class CellGameState<T extends CellGame,BasicGameState<T extends CellGame>,BasicThinker<T extends CellGame>,BasicThinkerState<T extends CellGame>>
        Returns:
        This CellGameState as a U
